newsitem.title: UK: LME aluminium hits fresh 2-1/4 year low.
newsitem.headline: LME aluminium hits fresh 2-1/4 year low.

text.p: Three month aluminium prices hit a fresh 2-1/4 year low of $1,335 a tonne on the London Metal Exchange (LME) on Monday after failing on the upside earlier in the day.
Traders said liquidation of stale long positions was behind much of the selling, which accelerated when sell stops were triggered below $1,340, last week's nadir.
"There were some stale longs from last week and when they started selling it just went," one floor trader said.
Traders said next chart support was likely to emerge at around $1,330 based on the lows in early June 1994.
On the upside resistance was pegged at $1,387 and the psychological $1,400 level.
Three months aluminium finished the morning kerb trading session at $1,342, down $15 from Friday's afternoon kerb close.
